Woe<S>1945</S> to thee that spoilest<S>7703</S>, and thou wast not spoiled<S>7703</S>; and dealest treacherously<S>898</S>, and they dealt not treacherously<S>898</S> with thee! when thou shalt cease<S>8552</S> to spoil<S>7703</S>, thou shalt be spoiled<S>7703</S>; and when thou shalt make an end<S>5239</S> to deal treacherously<S>898</S>, they shall deal treacherously<S>898</S> with thee.
O LORD<S>3068</S>, be gracious<S>2603</S> unto us; we have waited<S>6960</S> for thee: be thou their arm<S>2220</S> every morning<S>1242</S>, our salvation<S>3444</S> also in the time<S>6256</S> of trouble<S>6869</S>.
At the noise<S>6963</S> of the tumult<S>1995</S> the people<S>5971</S> fled<S>5074</S>; at the lifting up<S>7427</S> of thyself the nations<S>1471</S> were scattered<S>5310</S>.
And your spoil<S>7998</S> shall be gathered<S>622</S> like the gathering<S>625</S> of the caterpiller<S>2625</S>: as the running to and fro<S>4944</S> of locusts<S>1357</S> shall he run<S>8264</S> upon them.
The LORD<S>3068</S> is exalted<S>7682</S>; for he dwelleth<S>7931</S> on high<S>4791</S>: he hath filled<S>4390</S> Zion<S>6726</S> with judgment<S>4941</S> and righteousness<S>6666</S>.
And wisdom<S>2451</S> and knowledge<S>1847</S> shall be the stability<S>530</S> of thy times<S>6256</S>, and strength<S>2633</S> of salvation<S>3444</S>: the fear<S>3374</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> is his treasure<S>214</S>. <sup>salvation: Heb. salvations</sup>
Behold, their valiant ones<S>691</S> shall cry<S>6817</S> without<S>2351</S>: the ambassadors<S>4397</S> of peace<S>7965</S> shall weep<S>1058</S> bitterly<S>4751</S>. <sup>valiant: or, messengers</sup>
The highways<S>4546</S> lie waste<S>8074</S>, the wayfaring man<S>5674</S> <S>734</S> ceaseth<S>7673</S>: he hath broken<S>6565</S> the covenant<S>1285</S>, he hath despised<S>3988</S> the cities<S>5892</S>, he regardeth<S>2803</S> no man<S>582</S>.
The earth<S>776</S> mourneth<S>56</S> and languisheth<S>535</S>: Lebanon<S>3844</S> is ashamed<S>2659</S> and hewn down<S>7060</S>: Sharon<S>8289</S> is like a wilderness<S>6160</S>; and Bashan<S>1316</S> and Carmel<S>3760</S> shake off<S>5287</S> their fruits. <sup>hewn: or, withered away</sup>
Now will I rise<S>6965</S>, saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; now will I be exalted<S>7426</S>; now will I lift up<S>5375</S> myself.
Ye shall conceive<S>2029</S> chaff<S>2842</S>, ye shall bring forth<S>3205</S> stubble<S>7179</S>: your breath<S>7307</S>, as fire<S>784</S>, shall devour<S>398</S> you.
And the people<S>5971</S> shall be as the burnings<S>4955</S> of lime<S>7875</S>: as thorns<S>6975</S> cut up<S>3683</S> shall they be burned<S>3341</S> in the fire<S>784</S>.
Hear<S>8085</S>, ye that are far off<S>7350</S>, what I have done<S>6213</S>; and, ye that are near<S>7138</S>, acknowledge<S>3045</S> my might<S>1369</S>.
The sinners<S>2400</S> in Zion<S>6726</S> are afraid<S>6342</S>; fearfulness<S>7461</S> hath surprised<S>270</S> the hypocrites<S>2611</S>. Who among us shall dwell<S>1481</S> with the devouring<S>398</S> fire<S>784</S>? who among us shall dwell<S>1481</S> with everlasting<S>5769</S> burnings<S>4168</S>?
He that walketh<S>1980</S> righteously<S>6666</S>, and speaketh<S>1696</S> uprightly<S>4339</S>; he that despiseth<S>3988</S> the gain<S>1215</S> of oppressions<S>4642</S>, that shaketh<S>5287</S> his hands<S>3709</S> from holding<S>8551</S> of bribes<S>7810</S>, that stoppeth<S>331</S> his ears<S>241</S> from hearing<S>8085</S> of blood<S>1818</S>, and shutteth<S>6105</S> his eyes<S>5869</S> from seeing<S>7200</S> evil<S>7451</S>; <sup>righteously: Heb. in righteousnesses</sup> <sup>uprightly: Heb. uprightnesses</sup> <sup>oppressions: or, deceits</sup> <sup>blood: Heb. bloods</sup>
He shall dwell<S>7931</S> on high<S>4791</S>: his place of defence<S>4869</S> shall be the munitions<S>4679</S> of rocks<S>5553</S>: bread<S>3899</S> shall be given<S>5414</S> him; his waters<S>4325</S> shall be sure<S>539</S>. <sup>high: Heb. heights, or, high places</sup>
Thine eyes<S>5869</S> shall see<S>2372</S> the king<S>4428</S> in his beauty<S>3308</S>: they shall behold<S>7200</S> the land<S>776</S> that is very far off<S>4801</S>. <sup>that: Heb. of far distances</sup>
Thine heart<S>3820</S> shall meditate<S>1897</S> terror<S>367</S>. Where is the scribe<S>5608</S>? where is the receiver<S>8254</S>? where is he that counted<S>5608</S> the towers<S>4026</S>? <sup>receiver: Heb. weigher?</sup>
Thou shalt not see<S>7200</S> a fierce<S>3267</S> people<S>5971</S>, a people<S>5971</S> of a deeper<S>6012</S> speech<S>8193</S> than thou canst perceive<S>8085</S>; of a stammering<S>3932</S> tongue<S>3956</S>, that thou canst not understand<S>998</S>. <sup>stammering: or, ridiculous</sup>
Look<S>2372</S> upon Zion<S>6726</S>, the city<S>7151</S> of our solemnities<S>4150</S>: thine eyes<S>5869</S> shall see<S>7200</S> Jerusalem<S>3389</S> a quiet<S>7600</S> habitation<S>5116</S>, a tabernacle<S>168</S> that shall not be taken down<S>6813</S>; not one of the stakes<S>3489</S> thereof shall ever<S>5331</S> be removed<S>5265</S>, neither shall any of the cords<S>2256</S> thereof be broken<S>5423</S>.
But there the glorious<S>117</S> LORD<S>3068</S> will be unto us a place<S>4725</S> of broad<S>7342</S> <S>3027</S> rivers<S>5104</S> and streams<S>2975</S>; wherein shall go<S>3212</S> no<S>1077</S> galley<S>590</S> with oars<S>7885</S>, neither shall gallant<S>117</S> ship<S>6716</S> pass<S>5674</S> thereby. <sup>of: Heb. broad of spaces, or, hands</sup>
For the LORD<S>3068</S> is our judge<S>8199</S>, the LORD<S>3068</S> is our lawgiver<S>2710</S>, the LORD<S>3068</S> is our king<S>4428</S>; he will save<S>3467</S> us. <sup>lawgiver: Heb. statutemaker</sup>
Thy tacklings<S>2256</S> are loosed<S>5203</S>; they could not well<S>3653</S> strengthen<S>2388</S> their mast<S>8650</S>, they could not spread<S>6566</S> the sail<S>5251</S>: then is the prey<S>5706</S> of a great<S>4766</S> spoil<S>7998</S> divided<S>2505</S>; the lame<S>6455</S> take<S>962</S> the prey<S>957</S>. <sup>Thy: or, They have forsaken thy tacklings</sup>
And the inhabitant<S>7934</S> shall not say<S>559</S>, I am sick<S>2470</S>: the people<S>5971</S> that dwell<S>3427</S> therein shall be forgiven<S>5375</S> their iniquity<S>5771</S>.
